intro: Struthanthus hamatilis, commonly known as the roughleaf struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, giving them a rough texture, and it produces distinctive, elongated fruits that contain seeds. Struthanthus hamatilis is often found in desert scrub habitats and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability.
